briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: You must call Create() to really create the grid window and also call CreateGrid() or SetTable() to initialize the grid contents.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxWANTS_CHARS, const wxString &name=wxGridNameStr)
memberdef.name: wxGrid

briefdescription.para: Constructor creating the grid window.

detaileddescription.para: You must call either CreateGrid() or SetTable() to initialize the grid contents before using it.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.

detaileddescription.para: This will also destroy the associated grid table unless you passed a table object to the grid and specified that the grid should not take ownership of the table (see SetTable()).

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxWANTS_CHARS, const wxString &name=wxGridNameStr)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Creates the grid window for an object initialized using the default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: You must call either CreateGrid() or SetTable() to initialize the grid contents before using it.

briefdescription.para: Creates a grid with the specified initial number of rows and columns.

detaileddescription.para: Call this directly after the grid constructor. When you use this function wxGrid will create and manage a simple table of string values for you. All of the grid data will be stored in memory.

For applications with more complex data types or relationships, or for dealing with very large datasets, you should derive your own grid table class and pass a table object to the grid with SetTable().

briefdescription.para: Passes a pointer to a custom grid table to be used by the grid.

detaileddescription.para: This should be called after the grid constructor and before using the grid object. If takeOwnership is set to true then the table will be deleted by the wxGrid destructor.
Use this function instead of CreateGrid() when your application involves complex or non-string data or data sets that are too large to fit wholly in memory.

briefdescription.para: Turns the drawing of grid lines on or off.
Returns the pen used for vertical grid lines.

detaileddescription.para: This virtual function may be overridden in derived classes in order to change the appearance of individual grid lines for the given column col.
See GetRowGridLinePen() for an example.

briefdescription.para: Returns the pen used for grid lines.

detaileddescription.para: This virtual function may be overridden in derived classes in order to change the appearance of grid lines. Note that currently the pen width must be 1.

briefdescription.para: Returns the colour used for grid lines.
Returns the pen used for horizontal grid lines.

detaileddescription.para: This virtual function may be overridden in derived classes in order to change the appearance of individual grid line for the given row.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if drawing of grid lines is turned on, false otherwise.
Sets the colour used to draw grid lines.
Sets the arguments to the current column label alignment values.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment will be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment will be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Returns the orientation of the column labels (either wxHORIZONTAL or wxVERTICAL).
Returns the specified column label.

detaileddescription.para: The default grid table class provides column labels of the form A,B...Z,AA,AB...ZZ,AAA... If you are using a custom grid table you can override wxGridTableBase::GetColLabelValue() to provide your own labels.

briefdescription.para: Returns the colour used for the background of row and column labels.
Returns the font used for row and column labels.
Returns the colour used for row and column label text.
Returns the alignment used for row labels.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment will be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment will be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Returns the specified row label.

detaileddescription.para: The default grid table class provides numeric row labels. If you are using a custom grid table you can override wxGridTableBase::GetRowLabelValue() to provide your own labels.

briefdescription.para: Hides the column labels by calling SetColLabelSize() with a size of 0.

detaileddescription.para: Show labels again by calling that method with a width greater than 0.

briefdescription.para: Hides the row labels by calling SetRowLabelSize() with a size of 0.

detaileddescription.para: The labels can be shown again by calling SetRowLabelSize() with a width greater than 0.

briefdescription.para: Sets the horizontal and vertical alignment of column label text.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment should be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT. Vertical alignment should be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Sets the orientation of the column labels (either wxHORIZONTAL or wxVERTICAL).
Set the value for the given column label.

detaileddescription.para: If you are using a custom grid table you must override wxGridTableBase::SetColLabelValue() for this to have any effect.

briefdescription.para: Sets the background colour for row and column labels.
Sets the font for row and column labels.
Sets the colour for row and column label text.
Sets the horizontal and vertical alignment of row label text.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment should be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT. Vertical alignment should be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value for the given row label.

detaileddescription.para: If you are using a derived grid table you must override wxGridTableBase::SetRowLabelValue() for this to have any effect.

briefdescription.para: Call this in order to make the column labels use a native look by using wxRendererNative::DrawHeaderButton() internally.

detaileddescription.para: There is no equivalent method for drawing row columns as there is not native look for that. This option is useful when using wxGrid for displaying tables and not as a spread-sheet.

briefdescription.para: Enable the use of native header window for column labels.

detaileddescription.para: If this function is called with true argument, a wxHeaderCtrl is used instead to display the column labels instead of drawing them in wxGrid code itself. This has the advantage of making the grid look and feel perfectly the same as native applications (using SetUseNativeColLabels() the grid can be made to look more natively but it still doesn't feel natively, notably the column resizing and dragging still works slightly differently as it is implemented in wxWidgets itself) but results in different behaviour for column and row headers, for which there is no equivalent function, and, most importantly, is unsuitable for grids with huge numbers of columns as wxHeaderCtrl doesn't support virtual mode. Because of this, by default the grid does not use the native header control but you should call this function to enable it if you are using the grid to display tabular data and don't have thousands of columns in it.

Another difference between the default behaviour and the native header behaviour is that the latter provides the user with a context menu (which appears on right clicking the header) allowing to rearrange the grid columns if CanDragColMove() returns true. If you want to prevent this from happening for some reason, you need to define a handler for wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_RIGHT_CLICK event which simply does nothing (in particular doesn't skip the event) as this will prevent the default right click handling from working.
Also note that currently wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_RIGHT_DCLICK event is not generated for the column labels if the native columns header is used (but this limitation could possibly be lifted in the future).

description.para: Note that wxGridCellAttr can be used alternatively to most of these methods.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, int *horiz, int *vert) const
memberdef.name: GetCellAlignment

briefdescription.para: Sets the arguments to the horizontal and vertical text alignment values for the grid cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment will be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment will be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Returns the background colour of the cell at the specified location.
Returns the font for text in the grid cell at the specified location.
Returns the text colour for the grid cell at the specified location.
Returns the default cell alignment.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment will be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment will be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current default background colour for grid cells.
Returns the current default font for grid cell text.
Returns the current default colour for grid cell text.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, int horiz, int vert)
memberdef.name: SetCellAlignment

briefdescription.para: Sets the horizontal and vertical alignment for grid cell text at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment should be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment should be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Sets the horizontal and vertical alignment for grid cell text at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment should be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT.
Vertical alignment should be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Set the background colour for the given cell or all cells by default.
Sets the font for text in the grid cell at the specified location.
Sets the text colour for the given cell.
Sets the text colour for the given cell.
Sets the text colour for all cells by default.
Sets the default horizontal and vertical alignment for grid cell text.

detaileddescription.para: Horizontal alignment should be one of wxALIGN_LEFT, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_RIGHT. Vertical alignment should be one of wxALIGN_TOP, wxALIGN_CENTRE or wxALIGN_BOTTOM.

briefdescription.para: Sets the default background colour for grid cells.
Sets the default font to be used for grid cell text.
Sets the current default colour for grid cell text.

description.para: Note that wxGridCellAttr can be used alternatively to most of these methods.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the in-place edit control for the current grid cell can be used and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This function always returns false for the read-only cells.

briefdescription.para: Disables in-place editing of grid cells.

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to calling EnableCellEditControl(false).

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables in-place editing of grid cell data.

detaileddescription.para: The grid will issue either a wxEVT_GRID_EDITOR_SHOWN or wxEVT_GRID_EDITOR_HIDDEN event.

briefdescription.para: Makes the grid globally editable or read-only.

detaileddescription.para: If the edit argument is false this function sets the whole grid as read-only. If the argument is true the grid is set to the default state where cells may be editable. In the default state you can set single grid cells and whole rows and columns to be editable or read-only via wxGridCellAttr::SetReadOnly(). For single cells you can also use the shortcut function SetReadOnly().
For more information about controlling grid cell attributes see the wxGridCellAttr class and the wxGrid Overview.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the editor for the cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGridCellEditor and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the renderer for the grid cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGridCellRenderer and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the string contained in the cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: For simple applications where a grid object automatically uses a default grid table of string values you use this function together with SetCellValue() to access cell values. For more complex applications where you have derived your own grid table class that contains various data types (e.g. numeric, boolean or user-defined custom types) then you only use this function for those cells that contain string values.
See wxGridTableBase::CanGetValueAs() and the wxGrid Overview for more information.

briefdescription.para: Returns the string contained in the cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: For simple applications where a grid object automatically uses a default grid table of string values you use this function together with SetCellValue() to access cell values. For more complex applications where you have derived your own grid table class that contains various data types (e.g. numeric, boolean or user-defined custom types) then you only use this function for those cells that contain string values.
See wxGridTableBase::CanGetValueAs() and the wxGrid Overview for more information.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the current default grid cell editor.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGridCellEditor and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default editor for the specified cell.

detaileddescription.para: The base class version returns the editor appropriate for the current cell type but this method may be overridden in the derived classes to use custom editors for some cells by default.
Notice that the same may be achieved in a usually simpler way by associating a custom editor with the given cell or cells.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default editor for the specified cell.

detaileddescription.para: The base class version returns the editor appropriate for the current cell type but this method may be overridden in the derived classes to use custom editors for some cells by default.
Notice that the same may be achieved in a usually simpler way by associating a custom editor with the given cell or cells.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default editor for the cells containing values of the given type.

detaileddescription.para: The base class version returns the editor which was associated with the specified typeName when it was registered RegisterDataType() but this function may be overridden to return something different. This allows to override an editor used for one of the standard types.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the current default grid cell renderer.

detaileddescription.para: See wxGridCellRenderer and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default renderer for the given cell.

detaileddescription.para: The base class version returns the renderer appropriate for the current cell type but this method may be overridden in the derived classes to use custom renderers for some cells by default.
The caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default renderer for the cell containing values of the given type.
Hides the in-place cell edit control.
Returns true if the in-place edit control is currently enabled.
Returns true if the current cell is read-only.
Returns false if the whole grid has been set as read-only or true otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: See EnableEditing() for more information about controlling the editing status of grid cells.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the cell at the specified location can't be edited.
Register a new data type.

detaileddescription.para: The data types allow to naturally associate specific renderers and editors to the cells containing values of the given type. For example, the grid automatically registers a data type with the name wxGRID_VALUE_STRING which uses wxGridCellStringRenderer and wxGridCellTextEditor as its renderer and editor respectively -- this is the data type used by all the cells of the default wxGridStringTable, so this renderer and editor are used by default for all grid cells.

However if a custom table returns wxGRID_VALUE_BOOL from its wxGridTableBase::GetTypeName() method, then wxGridCellBoolRenderer and wxGridCellBoolEditor are used for it because the grid also registers a boolean data type with this name.

And as this mechanism is completely generic, you may register your own data types using your own custom renderers and editors. Just remember that the table must identify a cell as being of the given type for them to be used for this cell.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the new type. May be any string, but if the type name is the same as the name of an already registered type, including one of the standard ones (which are wxGRID_VALUE_STRING, wxGRID_VALUE_BOOL, wxGRID_VALUE_NUMBER, wxGRID_VALUE_FLOAT and wxGRID_VALUE_CHOICE), then the new registration information replaces the previously used renderer and editor.
The renderer to use for the cells of this type. Its ownership is taken by the grid, i.e. it will call DecRef() on this pointer when it doesn't need it any longer.
The editor to use for the cells of this type. Its ownership is also taken by the grid.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of the current grid cell to the current in-place edit control value.

detaileddescription.para: This is called automatically when the grid cursor moves from the current cell to a new cell. It is also a good idea to call this function when closing a grid since any edits to the final cell location will not be saved otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the editor for the grid cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: The grid will take ownership of the pointer.
See wxGridCellEditor and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.

briefdescription.para: Sets the renderer for the grid cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: The grid will take ownership of the pointer.
See wxGridCellRenderer and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.

briefdescription.para: Sets the string value for the cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: For simple applications where a grid object automatically uses a default grid table of string values you use this function together with GetCellValue() to access cell values. For more complex applications where you have derived your own grid table class that contains various data types (e.g. numeric, boolean or user-defined custom types) then you only use this function for those cells that contain string values.
See wxGridTableBase::CanSetValueAs() and the wxGrid Overview for more information.

briefdescription.para: Sets the string value for the cell at the specified location.

detaileddescription.para: For simple applications where a grid object automatically uses a default grid table of string values you use this function together with GetCellValue() to access cell values. For more complex applications where you have derived your own grid table class that contains various data types (e.g. numeric, boolean or user-defined custom types) then you only use this function for those cells that contain string values.
See wxGridTableBase::CanSetValueAs() and the wxGrid Overview for more information.

xrefdescription.para: Please use SetCellValue(int,int,const wxString&) or SetCellValue(const wxGridCellCoords&,const wxString&) instead.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the string value for the cell at the specified location.

For simple applications where a grid object automatically uses a default grid table of string values you use this function together with GetCellValue() to access cell values. For more complex applications where you have derived your own grid table class that contains various data types (e.g. numeric, boolean or user-defined custom types) then you only use this function for those cells that contain string values.
See wxGridTableBase::CanSetValueAs() and the wxGrid Overview for more information.

briefdescription.para: Sets the specified column to display boolean values.
Sets the specified column to display data in a custom format.

detaileddescription.para: This method provides an alternative to defining a custom grid table which would return typeName from its GetTypeName() method for the cells in this column: while it doesn't really change the type of the cells in this column, it does associate the renderer and editor used for the cells of the specified type with them.
See the wxGrid Overview for more information on working with custom data types.

briefdescription.para: Sets the specified column to display floating point values with the given width and precision.
Sets the specified column to display integer values.
Sets the default editor for grid cells.

detaileddescription.para: The grid will take ownership of the pointer.
See wxGridCellEditor and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.

briefdescription.para: Sets the default renderer for grid cells.

detaileddescription.para: The grid will take ownership of the pointer.
See wxGridCellRenderer and the wxGrid Overview for more information about cell editors and renderers.

briefdescription.para: Makes the cell at the specified location read-only or editable.
Displays the in-place cell edit control for the current cell.
Automatically sets the height and width of all rows and columns to fit their contents.
Automatically adjusts width of the column to fit its label.
Automatically sizes the column to fit its contents.

detaileddescription.para: If setAsMin is true the calculated width will also be set as the minimal width for the column.

briefdescription.para: Automatically sizes all columns to fit their contents.

detaileddescription.para: If setAsMin is true the calculated widths will also be set as the minimal widths for the columns.

briefdescription.para: Automatically sizes the row to fit its contents.

detaileddescription.para: If setAsMin is true the calculated height will also be set as the minimal height for the row.

briefdescription.para: Automatically adjusts height of the row to fit its label.
Automatically sizes all rows to fit their contents.

detaileddescription.para: If setAsMin is true the calculated heights will also be set as the minimal heights for the rows.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current height of the column labels.
Returns the minimal width to which a column may be resized.

detaileddescription.para: Use SetColMinimalAcceptableWidth() to change this value globally or SetColMinimalWidth() to do it for individual columns.

briefdescription.para: Returns the width of the specified column.
Returns true if the specified column is not currently hidden.
Returns the default height for column labels.
Returns the current default width for grid columns.
Returns the default width for the row labels.
Returns the current default height for grid rows.
Returns the minimal size to which rows can be resized.

detaileddescription.para: Use SetRowMinimalAcceptableHeight() to change this value globally or SetRowMinimalHeight() to do it for individual cells.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current width of the row labels.
Returns the height of the specified row.
Returns true if the specified row is not currently hidden.
Sets the height of the column labels.

detaileddescription.para: If height equals to wxGRID_AUTOSIZE then height is calculated automatically so that no label is truncated. Note that this could be slow for a large table.

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimal width to which the user can resize columns.
Sets the minimal width for the specified column col.

detaileddescription.para: It is usually best to call this method during grid creation as calling it later will not resize the column to the given minimal width even if it is currently narrower than it.
width must be greater than the minimal acceptable column width as returned by GetColMinimalAcceptableWidth().

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of the specified column.

parameterdescription.para: The column index.
The new column width in pixels, 0 to hide the column or -1 to fit the column width to its label width.

briefdescription.para: Hides the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: To show the column later you need to call SetColSize() with non-0 width or ShowCol().

parameterdescription.para: The column index.

briefdescription.para: Shows the previously hidden column by resizing it to non-0 size.
Sets the default width for columns in the grid.

detaileddescription.para: This will only affect columns subsequently added to the grid unless resizeExistingCols is true.
If width is less than GetColMinimalAcceptableWidth(), then the minimal acceptable width is used instead of it.

briefdescription.para: Sets the default height for rows in the grid.

detaileddescription.para: This will only affect rows subsequently added to the grid unless resizeExistingRows is true.
If height is less than GetRowMinimalAcceptableHeight(), then the minimal acceptable height is used instead of it.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of the row labels.

detaileddescription.para: If width equals wxGRID_AUTOSIZE then width is calculated automatically so that no label is truncated. Note that this could be slow for a large table.

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimal row height used by default.

detaileddescription.para: See SetColMinimalAcceptableWidth() for more information.

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimal height for the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: See SetColMinimalWidth() for more information.

briefdescription.para: Sets the height of the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: See SetColSize() for more information.

briefdescription.para: Hides the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: To show the row later you need to call SetRowSize() with non-0 width or ShowRow().

parameterdescription.para: The row index.

briefdescription.para: Shows the previously hidden row by resizing it to non-0 size.
Get size information for all columns at once.

detaileddescription.para: This method is useful when the information about all column widths needs to be saved. The widths can be later restored using SetColSizes().

briefdescription.para: Get size information for all row at once.
Restore all columns sizes.

detaileddescription.para: This is usually called with wxGridSizesInfo object previously returned by GetColSizes().

briefdescription.para: Restore all rows sizes.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, int num_rows, int num_cols)
memberdef.name: SetCellSize

briefdescription.para: Set the size of the cell.

detaileddescription.para: Specifying a value of more than 1 in num_rows or num_cols will make the cell at (row, col) span the block of the specified size, covering the other cells which would be normally shown in it. Passing 1 for both arguments resets the cell to normal appearance.

parameterdescription.para: The row of the cell.
The column of the cell.
Number of rows to be occupied by this cell, must be >= 1.
Number of columns to be occupied by this cell, must be >= 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, int *num_rows, int *num_cols) const
memberdef.name: GetCellSize

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the cell in number of cells covered by it.

detaileddescription.para: For normal cells, the function fills both num_rows and num_cols with 1 and returns CellSpan_None. For cells which span multiple cells, i.e. for which SetCellSize() had been called, the returned values are the same ones as were passed to SetCellSize() call and the function return value is CellSpan_Main.

More unexpectedly, perhaps, the returned values may be negative for the cells which are inside a span covered by a cell occupying multiple rows or columns. They correspond to the offset of the main cell of the span from the cell passed to this functions and the function returns CellSpan_Inside value to indicate this.

As an example, consider a 3*3 grid with the cell (1, 1) (the one in the middle) having a span of 2 rows and 2 columns, i.e. the grid looks like +----+----+----+ |||| +----+----+----+ ||| +----+| ||| +----+----+----+ Then the function returns 2 and 2 in num_rows and num_cols for the cell (1, 1) itself and -1 and -1 for the cell (2, 2) as well as -1 and 0 for the cell (2, 1).

parameterdescription.para: The row of the cell.
The column of the cell.
Pointer to variable receiving the number of rows, must not be NULL.
Pointer to variable receiving the number of columns, must not be NULL.

simplesect.para: The kind of this cell span (the return value is new in wxWidgets 2.9.1, this function was void in previous wxWidgets versions).

briefdescription.para: Get the number of rows and columns allocated for this cell.

detaileddescription.para: This overload doesn't return a CellSpan value but the values returned may still be negative, see GetCellSize(int, int, int *, int *) for details.

description.para: Functions controlling various interactive mouse operations.

By default, columns and rows can be resized by dragging the edges of their labels (this can be disabled using DisableDragColSize() and DisableDragRowSize() methods). And if grid line dragging is enabled with EnableDragGridSize() they can also be resized by dragging the right or bottom edge of the grid cells.
Columns can also be moved to interactively change their order but this needs to be explicitly enabled with EnableDragColMove().

briefdescription.para: Return true if the dragging of cells is enabled or false otherwise.
Returns true if columns can be moved by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Columns can be moved by dragging on their labels.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the given column can be resized by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns true if resizing the columns interactively is globally enabled, i.e. if DisableDragColSize() hadn't been called, and if this column wasn't explicitly marked as non-resizable with DisableColResize().

briefdescription.para: Return true if the dragging of grid lines to resize rows and columns is enabled or false otherwise.
Returns true if the given row can be resized by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: This is the same as CanDragColSize() but for rows.

briefdescription.para: Disable interactive resizing of the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: This method allows to disable resizing of an individual column in a grid where the columns are otherwise resizable (which is the case by default).

Notice that currently there is no way to make some columns resizable in a grid where columns can't be resized by default as there doesn't seem to be any need for this in practice. There is also no way to make the column marked as fixed using this method resizable again because it is supposed that fixed columns are used for static parts of the grid and so should remain fixed during the entire grid lifetime.
Also notice that disabling interactive column resizing will not prevent the program from changing the column size.

briefdescription.para: Disable interactive resizing of the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: This is the same as DisableColResize() but for rows.

briefdescription.para: Disables column moving by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to passing false to EnableDragColMove().

briefdescription.para: Disables column sizing by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to passing false to EnableDragColSize().

briefdescription.para: Disable mouse dragging of grid lines to resize rows and columns.

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to passing false to EnableDragGridSize()

briefdescription.para: Disables row sizing by dragging with the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to passing false to EnableDragRowSize().

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables cell dragging with the mouse.
Enables or disables column moving by dragging with the mouse.
Enables or disables column sizing by dragging with the mouse.
Enables or disables row and column resizing by dragging gridlines with the mouse.
Enables or disables row sizing by dragging with the mouse.
Returns the column ID of the specified column position.
Returns the position of the specified column.
Sets the position of the specified column.
Sets the positions of all columns at once.

detaileddescription.para: This method takes an array containing the indices of the columns in their display order, i.e. uses the same convention as wxHeaderCtrl::SetColumnsOrder().

briefdescription.para: Resets the position of the columns to the default.
Returns the current grid cell column position.
Returns the current grid cell row position.
Make the given cell current and ensure it is visible.

detaileddescription.para: This method is equivalent to calling MakeCellVisible() and SetGridCursor() and so, as with the latter, a wxEVT_GRID_SELECT_CELL event is generated by it and the selected cell doesn't change if the event is vetoed.

briefdescription.para: Make the given cell current and ensure it is visible.

detaileddescription.para: This method is equivalent to calling MakeCellVisible() and SetGridCursor() and so, as with the latter, a wxEVT_GRID_SELECT_CELL event is generated by it and the selected cell doesn't change if the event is vetoed.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor down by one row.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor down in the current column such that it skips to the beginning or end of a block of non-empty cells.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor left by one column.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor left in the current row such that it skips to the beginning or end of a block of non-empty cells.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor right by one column.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor right in the current row such that it skips to the beginning or end of a block of non-empty cells.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor up by one row.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor up in the current column such that it skips to the beginning or end of a block of non-empty cells.

detaileddescription.para: If a block of cells was previously selected it will expand if the argument is true or be cleared if the argument is false.

briefdescription.para: Moves the grid cursor down by some number of rows so that the previous bottom visible row becomes the top visible row.
Moves the grid cursor up by some number of rows so that the previous top visible row becomes the bottom visible row.
Set the grid cursor to the specified cell.

detaileddescription.para: The grid cursor indicates the current cell and can be moved by the user using the arrow keys or the mouse.
Calling this function generates a wxEVT_GRID_SELECT_CELL event and if the event handler vetoes this event, the cursor is not moved.
This function doesn't make the target call visible, use GoToCell() to do this.

briefdescription.para: Set the grid cursor to the specified cell.

detaileddescription.para: The grid cursor indicates the current cell and can be moved by the user using the arrow keys or the mouse.
Calling this function generates a wxEVT_GRID_SELECT_CELL event and if the event handler vetoes this event, the cursor is not moved.
This function doesn't make the target call visible, use GoToCell() to do this.

briefdescription.para: Deselects all cells that are currently selected.
Returns an array of individually selected cells.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that this array does not contain all the selected cells in general as it doesn't include the cells selected as part of column, row or block selection. You must use this method, GetSelectedCols(), GetSelectedRows() and GetSelectionBlockTopLeft() and GetSelectionBlockBottomRight() methods to obtain the entire selection in general.

Please notice this behaviour is by design and is needed in order to support grids of arbitrary size (when an entire column is selected in a grid with a million of columns, we don't want to create an array with a million of entries in this function, instead it returns an empty array and GetSelectedCols() returns an array containing one element).

briefdescription.para: Returns an array of selected columns.

detaileddescription.para: Please notice that this method alone is not sufficient to find all the selected columns as it contains only the columns which were individually selected but not those being part of the block selection or being selected in virtue of all of their cells being selected individually, please see GetSelectedCells() for more details.

briefdescription.para: Returns an array of selected rows.

detaileddescription.para: Please notice that this method alone is not sufficient to find all the selected rows as it contains only the rows which were individually selected but not those being part of the block selection or being selected in virtue of all of their cells being selected individually, please see GetSelectedCells() for more details.

briefdescription.para: Returns the colour used for drawing the selection background.
Returns an array of the bottom right corners of blocks of selected cells.

detaileddescription.para: Please see GetSelectedCells() for more information about the selection representation in wxGrid.

briefdescription.para: Returns an array of the top left corners of blocks of selected cells.

detaileddescription.para: Please see GetSelectedCells() for more information about the selection representation in wxGrid.

briefdescription.para: Returns the colour used for drawing the selection foreground.
Returns the current selection mode.
Returns true if the given cell is selected.
Returns true if the given cell is selected.
Returns true if there are currently any selected cells, rows, columns or blocks.
Selects all cells in the grid.

memberdef.argsstring: (int topRow, int leftCol, int bottomRow, int rightCol, bool addToSelected=false)
memberdef.name: SelectBlock

briefdescription.para: Selects a rectangular block of cells.

detaileddescription.para: If addToSelected is false then any existing selection will be deselected; if true the column will be added to the existing selection.

briefdescription.para: Selects a rectangular block of cells.

detaileddescription.para: If addToSelected is false then any existing selection will be deselected; if true the column will be added to the existing selection.

briefdescription.para: Selects the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: If addToSelected is false then any existing selection will be deselected; if true the column will be added to the existing selection.
This method won't select anything if the current selection mode is wxGridSelectRows.

briefdescription.para: Selects the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: If addToSelected is false then any existing selection will be deselected; if true the row will be added to the existing selection.
This method won't select anything if the current selection mode is wxGridSelectColumns.

briefdescription.para: Set the colour to be used for drawing the selection background.
Set the colour to be used for drawing the selection foreground.
Set the selection behaviour of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: The existing selection is converted to conform to the new mode if possible and discarded otherwise (e.g. any individual selected cells are deselected if the new mode allows only the selection of the entire rows or columns).

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of pixels per horizontal scroll increment.

detaileddescription.para: The default is 15.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of pixels per vertical scroll increment.

detaileddescription.para: The default is 15.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int col, bool wholeCellVisible=true) const
memberdef.name: IsVisible

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a cell is either entirely or at least partially visible in the grid window.

detaileddescription.para: By default, the cell must be entirely visible for this function to return true but if wholeCellVisible is false, the function returns true even if the cell is only partially visible.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a cell is either entirely or at least partially visible in the grid window.

detaileddescription.para: By default, the cell must be entirely visible for this function to return true but if wholeCellVisible is false, the function returns true even if the cell is only partially visible.

briefdescription.para: Brings the specified cell into the visible grid cell area with minimal scrolling.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if the cell is already visible.

briefdescription.para: Brings the specified cell into the visible grid cell area with minimal scrolling.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if the cell is already visible.

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of pixels per horizontal scroll increment.

detaileddescription.para: The default is 15.

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of pixels per vertical scroll increment.

detaileddescription.para: The default is 15.

briefdescription.para: Convert grid cell coordinates to grid window pixel coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the rectangle that encloses the block of cells limited by topLeft and bottomRight cell in device coords and clipped to the client size of the grid window.

briefdescription.para: Return the rectangle corresponding to the grid cell's size and position in logical coordinates.
Return the rectangle corresponding to the grid cell's size and position in logical coordinates.
Returns the column at the given pixel position.

parameterdescription.para: The x position to evaluate.
If true, rather than returning wxNOT_FOUND, it returns either the first or last column depending on whether x is too far to the left or right respectively.

briefdescription.para: Returns the column whose right hand edge is close to the given logical x position.

detaileddescription.para: If no column edge is near to this position wxNOT_FOUND is returned.

briefdescription.para: Translates logical pixel coordinates to the grid cell coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that this function expects logical coordinates on input so if you use this function in a mouse event handler you need to translate the mouse position, which is expressed in device coordinates, to logical ones.

briefdescription.para: Translates logical pixel coordinates to the grid cell coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that this function expects logical coordinates on input so if you use this function in a mouse event handler you need to translate the mouse position, which is expressed in device coordinates, to logical ones.

briefdescription.para: Returns the row whose bottom edge is close to the given logical y position.

detaileddescription.para: If no row edge is near to this position wxNOT_FOUND is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the grid row that corresponds to the logical y coordinate.

detaileddescription.para: Returns wxNOT_FOUND if there is no row at the y position.

briefdescription.para: Appends one or more new columns to the right of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: The updateLabels argument is not used at present. If you are using a derived grid table class you will need to override wxGridTableBase::AppendCols(). See InsertCols() for further information.

simplesect.para: true on success or false if appending columns failed.

briefdescription.para: Appends one or more new rows to the bottom of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: The updateLabels argument is not used at present. If you are using a derived grid table class you will need to override wxGridTableBase::AppendRows(). See InsertRows() for further information.

simplesect.para: true on success or false if appending rows failed.

briefdescription.para: Return true if the horizontal grid lines stop at the last column boundary or false if they continue to the end of the window.

detaileddescription.para: The default is to clip grid lines.

briefdescription.para: Return true if the vertical grid lines stop at the last row boundary or false if they continue to the end of the window.

detaileddescription.para: The default is to clip grid lines.

briefdescription.para: Increments the grid's batch count.

detaileddescription.para: When the count is greater than zero repainting of the grid is suppressed. Each call to BeginBatch must be matched by a later call to EndBatch(). Code that does a lot of grid modification can be enclosed between BeginBatch() and EndBatch() calls to avoid screen flicker. The final EndBatch() call will cause the grid to be repainted.
Notice that you should use wxGridUpdateLocker which ensures that there is always a matching EndBatch() call for this BeginBatch() if possible instead of calling this method directly.

briefdescription.para: Clears all data in the underlying grid table and repaints the grid.

detaileddescription.para: The table is not deleted by this function. If you are using a derived table class then you need to override wxGridTableBase::Clear() for this function to have any effect.

briefdescription.para: Change whether the horizontal grid lines are clipped by the end of the last column.

detaileddescription.para: By default the grid lines are not drawn beyond the end of the last column but after calling this function with clip set to false they will be drawn across the entire grid window.

briefdescription.para: Change whether the vertical grid lines are clipped by the end of the last row.

detaileddescription.para: By default the grid lines are not drawn beyond the end of the last row but after calling this function with clip set to false they will be drawn across the entire grid window.

briefdescription.para: Deletes one or more columns from a grid starting at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: The updateLabels argument is not used at present. If you are using a derived grid table class you will need to override wxGridTableBase::DeleteCols(). See InsertCols() for further information.

simplesect.para: true on success or false if deleting columns failed.

briefdescription.para: Deletes one or more rows from a grid starting at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: The updateLabels argument is not used at present. If you are using a derived grid table class you will need to override wxGridTableBase::DeleteRows(). See InsertRows() for further information.

simplesect.para: true on success or false if appending rows failed.

briefdescription.para: Decrements the grid's batch count.

detaileddescription.para: When the count is greater than zero repainting of the grid is suppressed. Each previous call to BeginBatch() must be matched by a later call to EndBatch(). Code that does a lot of grid modification can be enclosed between BeginBatch() and EndBatch() calls to avoid screen flicker. The final EndBatch() will cause the grid to be repainted.

briefdescription.para: Overridden wxWindow method.
Causes immediate repainting of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: Use this instead of the usual wxWindow::Refresh().

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of times that BeginBatch() has been called without (yet) matching calls to EndBatch().

detaileddescription.para: While the grid's batch count is greater than zero the display will not be updated.

briefdescription.para: Returns the total number of grid columns.

detaileddescription.para: This is the same as the number of columns in the underlying grid table.

briefdescription.para: Returns the total number of grid rows.

detaileddescription.para: This is the same as the number of rows in the underlying grid table.

briefdescription.para: Returns the attribute for the given cell creating one if necessary.

detaileddescription.para: If the cell already has an attribute, it is returned. Otherwise a new attribute is created, associated with the cell and returned. In any case the caller must call DecRef() on the returned pointer.
This function may only be called if CanHaveAttributes() returns true.

briefdescription.para: Returns a base pointer to the current table object.

detaileddescription.para: The returned pointer is still owned by the grid.

briefdescription.para: Inserts one or more new columns into a grid with the first new column at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that inserting the columns in the grid requires grid table cooperation: when this method is called, grid object begins by requesting the underlying grid table to insert new columns. If this is successful the table notifies the grid and the grid updates the display. For a default grid (one where you have called CreateGrid()) this process is automatic. If you are using a custom grid table (specified with SetTable()) then you must override wxGridTableBase::InsertCols() in your derived table class.

parameterdescription.para: The position which the first newly inserted column will have.
The number of columns to insert.
Currently not used.

simplesect.para: true if the columns were successfully inserted, false if an error occurred (most likely the table couldn't be updated).

briefdescription.para: Inserts one or more new rows into a grid with the first new row at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that you must implement wxGridTableBase::InsertRows() if you use a grid with a custom table, please see InsertCols() for more information.

parameterdescription.para: The position which the first newly inserted row will have.
The number of rows to insert.
Currently not used.

simplesect.para: true if the rows were successfully inserted, false if an error occurred (most likely the table couldn't be updated).

briefdescription.para: Invalidates the cached attribute for the given cell.

detaileddescription.para: For efficiency reasons, wxGrid may cache the recently used attributes (currently it caches only the single most recently used one, in fact) which can result in the cell appearance not being refreshed even when the attribute returned by your custom wxGridCellAttrProvider-derived class has changed. To force the grid to refresh the cell attribute, this function may be used. Notice that calling it will not result in actually redrawing the cell, you still need to call wxWindow::RefreshRect() to invalidate the area occupied by the cell in the window to do this. Also note that you don't need to call this function if you store the attributes in wxGrid itself, i.e. use its SetAttr() and similar methods, it is only useful when using a separate custom attributes provider.

parameterdescription.para: The row of the cell whose attribute needs to be queried again.
The column of the cell whose attribute needs to be queried again.

briefdescription.para: Sets the cell attributes for all cells in the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: For more information about controlling grid cell attributes see the wxGridCellAttr cell attribute class and the wxGrid Overview.

briefdescription.para: Sets the extra margins used around the grid area.

detaileddescription.para: A grid may occupy more space than needed for its data display and this function allows to set how big this extra space is

briefdescription.para: Sets the cell attributes for all cells in the specified row.

detaileddescription.para: The grid takes ownership of the attribute pointer.
See the wxGridCellAttr class for more information about controlling cell attributes.

description.para: wxGrid doesn't provide any support for sorting the data but it does generate events allowing the user code to sort it and supports displaying the sort indicator in the column used for sorting.

To use wxGrid sorting support you need to handle wxEVT_GRID_COL_SORT event (and not veto it) and resort the data displayed in the grid. The grid will automatically update the sorting indicator on the column which was clicked.

You can also call the functions in this section directly to update the sorting indicator. Once again, they don't do anything with the grid data, it remains your responsibility to actually sort it appropriately.

briefdescription.para: Return the column in which the sorting indicator is currently displayed.

detaileddescription.para: Returns wxNOT_FOUND if sorting indicator is not currently displayed at all.

briefdescription.para: Return true if this column is currently used for sorting.
Return true if the current sorting order is ascending or false if it is descending.

detaileddescription.para: It only makes sense to call this function if GetSortingColumn() returns a valid column index and not wxNOT_FOUND.

briefdescription.para: Set the column to display the sorting indicator in and its direction.

parameterdescription.para: The column to display the sorting indicator in or wxNOT_FOUND to remove any currently displayed sorting indicator.
If true, display the ascending sort indicator, otherwise display the descending sort indicator.

briefdescription.para: Remove any currently shown sorting indicator.

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to calling SetSortingColumn() with wxNOT_FOUND first argument.

description.para: Return the various child windows of wxGrid.

wxGrid is an empty parent window for 4 children representing the column labels window (top), the row labels window (left), the corner window (top left) and the main grid window. It may be necessary to use these individual windows and not the wxGrid window itself if you need to handle events for them (this can be done using wxEvtHandler::Connect() or wxWindow::PushEventHandler()) or do something else requiring the use of the correct window pointer. Notice that you should not, however, change these windows (e.g. reposition them or draw over them) because they are managed by wxGrid itself.

briefdescription.para: Return the main grid window containing the grid cells.

detaileddescription.para: This window is always shown.

briefdescription.para: Return the row labels window.

detaileddescription.para: This window is not shown if the row labels were hidden using HideRowLabels().

briefdescription.para: Return the column labels window.

detaileddescription.para: This window is not shown if the columns labels were hidden using HideColLabels().

Depending on whether UseNativeColHeader() was called or not this can be either a wxHeaderCtrl or a plain wxWindow. This function returns a valid window pointer in either case but in the former case you can also use GetGridColHeader() to access it if you need wxHeaderCtrl-specific functionality.

briefdescription.para: Return the window in the top left grid corner.

detaileddescription.para: This window is shown only of both columns and row labels are shown and normally doesn't contain anything. Clicking on it is handled by wxGrid however and can be used to select the entire grid.

briefdescription.para: Return the header control used for column labels display.

detaileddescription.para: This function can only be called if UseNativeColHeader() had been called.

briefdescription.para: The default selection mode allowing selection of the individual cells as well as of the entire rows and columns.
The selection mode allowing the selection of the entire rows only.

detaileddescription.para: The user won't be able to select any cells or columns in this mode.

briefdescription.para: The selection mode allowing the selection of the entire columns only.

detaileddescription.para: The user won't be able to select any cells or rows in this mode.

briefdescription.para: The selection mode allowing the user to select either the entire columns or the entire rows but not individual cells nor blocks.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that while this constant is defined as wxGridSelectColumns|wxGridSelectRows this doesn't mean that all the other combinations are valid -- at least currently they are not.

briefdescription.para: Different selection modes supported by the grid.
This cell is inside a span covered by another cell.
This is a normal, non-spanning cell.
This cell spans several physical wxGrid cells.
Return values for GetCellSize().
Returns true if this grid has support for cell attributes.

detaileddescription.para: The grid supports attributes if it has the associated table which, in turn, has attributes support, i.e. wxGridTableBase::CanHaveAttributes() returns true.

briefdescription.para: Get the minimal width of the given column/row.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned by this function may be different than that returned by GetColMinimalAcceptableWidth() if SetColMinimalWidth() had been called for this column.

briefdescription.para: Returns the coordinate of the right border specified column.
Returns the coordinate of the left border specified column.
Returns the minimal size for the given column.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned by this function may be different than that returned by GetRowMinimalAcceptableHeight() if SetRowMinimalHeight() had been called for this row.

briefdescription.para: wxGrid and its related classes are used for displaying and editing tabular data.

detaileddescription.para: They provide a rich set of features for display, editing, and interacting with a variety of data sources. For simple applications, and to help you get started, wxGrid is the only class you need to refer to directly. It will set up default instances of the other classes and manage them for you. For more complex applications you can derive your own classes for custom grid views, grid data tables, cell editors and renderers. The wxGrid Overview has examples of simple and more complex applications, explains the relationship between the various grid classes and has a summary of the keyboard shortcuts and mouse functions provided by wxGrid.

A wxGridTableBase class holds the actual data to be displayed by a wxGrid class. One or more wxGrid classes may act as a view for one table class. The default table class is called wxGridStringTable and holds an array of strings. An instance of such a class is created by CreateGrid().
wxGridCellRenderer is the abstract base class for rendering contents in a cell. The following renderers are predefined:
The look of a cell can be further defined using wxGridCellAttr. An object of this type may be returned by wxGridTableBase::GetAttr().
wxGridCellEditor is the abstract base class for editing the value of a cell. The following editors are predefined:
Please see wxGridEvent, wxGridSizeEvent, wxGridRangeSelectEvent, and wxGridEditorCreatedEvent for the documentation of all event types you can use with wxGrid.
Library:wxAdvanced
Category:Grid Related Classes
